Jargon Term: abnormal heart rhythm which would come and go occasionally
ablate some of the cardiac tissue that might have been contributing to your abnormal rhythm

parts of cardiac tissue contributing to your abnormal heart rhythm could not be completely ablated because it was too close to your coronary arteries and there was a lot of calcification around the area
You will be sent home with [**Initials (NamePattern4) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern4) **] of Hearts monitor which will be further explained to you before leaving the hospital.

You will wear this monitor for several days and push an event button to record when you are feeling symptoms. At this time, the monitor will record your heart rhythm, which can be analyzed afterwards by your cardiologist.
